meanings.definition: To slide uncontrollably on a wet surface, typically while driving a vehicle.
meanings.sent1: The car hydroplaned on the rainy road.
meanings.sent2: I hydroplaned when the road was wet.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel hydroplaned across the slippery sidewalk.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts seemed to hydroplane through her mind, out of control.
meanings.sent5: The skateboarder hydroplaned down the wet ramp, unable to stop.

meanings.definition: Past tense of hydroplane: to have slid uncontrollably on a wet surface.
meanings.sent1: Yesterday, my car hydroplaned on the flooded street.
meanings.sent2: She hydroplaned on the icy driveway last winter.
meanings.sent3: The penguin hydroplaned on the icy patch, looking like a clumsy dancer.
meanings.sent4: His words hydroplaned out of his mouth, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent5: The boat hydroplaned over the waves, gliding effortlessly.
